SENT.plain: Tie 1 is an endothelial specific transmembrane receptor tyrosine kinase and may be required during angiogenesis
Using in situ hybridization, we measured tie 1 mRNA in ischemic brain (n=15)
Rats were subjected to middle cerebral artery (MCA) occlusion by a single fibrin rich clot
Expression of tie 1 was not detected in non ischemic brain
Cerebral microvessels expressed tie 1 in the ischemic lesion as early as 2 h after MCA occlusion
The number of microvessels containing tie 1 mRNA decreased in the ischemic lesion at 8 h after MCA occlusion
However, expression of tie 1 increased on microvessels at 24 h and 14 days after ischemia and tie 1 was primarily localized to the microvessels bordering pan necrotic tissue
Ninety-seven percent of cerebral vessels which expressed tie 1 mRNA had diameters of 3.7+/-0.17 microm
Our findings suggest a role for tie 1 in cerebral microvascular remodeling after embolic stroke
